DataElement.preferredName: Patient Uncorrected Primary Obstruction Severe Regurgitation Valve Disease Eligibility Determination Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to Eligibility of a patient with uncorrected blockage of the normal flow of the contents of an anatomical passageway or flow in the opposite direction from normal in Any of the four heart valves, that  is intensely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent, occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value._The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown/not applicable.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Uncorrected Primary Obstruction Severe Regurgitation Valve Disease Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to Eligibility of a patient with uncorrected blockage of the normal flow of the contents of an anatomical passageway or flow in the opposite direction from normal in Any of the four heart valves, that  is intensely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent, occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Vectorcardiograph Uncorrected Primary Obstruction Severe Regurgitation Cardiac Valve Disease or Disorder Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: A measurement of electric heart vectors whereby this type of measurement does not consider the distortions caused by the boundary and internal inhomogeneities of the body. These lead systems assure the direction of the spatial line connecting an electrode pair and yields the orientation of the corresponding lead vectors.:Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.:Blockage of a passageway.:Intensely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.:Flow in the opposite direction from normal, as the casting up of undigested food or gas from the stomach, or the backward flowing of blood into the heart, or between the chambers of the heart when a valve is incompetent.:Any of the four heart valves, including the two atrioventricular valves and the two semilunar valves, that regulate the flow of blood through the chambers of the heart.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: A measurement of electric heart vectors whereby this type of measurement does not consider the distortions caused by the boundary and internal inhomogeneities of the body. These lead systems assure the direction of the spatial line connecting an electrode pair and yields the orientation of the corresponding lead vectors.
Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.
Blockage of the normal flow of the contents of an anatomical passageway.
Intensely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.

Flow in the opposite direction from normal, as the casting up of undigested food or gas from the stomach, or the backward flowing of blood into the heart, or between the chambers of the heart when a valve is incompetent.
Any of the four heart valves, including the two atrioventricular valves and the two semilunar valves, which regulate the flow of blood through the chambers of the heart.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.
